intro: Leucothoe brevistipes, commonly known as the narrow-leaved leucothoe, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the southeastern United States, particularly found in Georgia and South Carolina. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade, making it a suitable ornamental plant for woodland gardens. Its compact growth habit and attractive foliage make it a valuable addition to native plant landscapes.
